nodes.text: An alphanumeric designated system had not been mapped by the time of the Galactic Civil War, and was cluttered with both planetoids and debris. In 5 ABY, the Galactic Empire's 204th Imperial Fighter Wing traveled to the system after being attacked in three other systems by the New Republic refitted Star Destroyer Deliverance and its starfighter wing. The Deliverance arrived out of hyperspace deep into the system to surprise the 204th, having followed a communications signal burst from the 204th's bulk freighter Yadeez.

The Deliverance forced the starships of the Imperial fighter wing towards one of the system's unmapped planetoids, delaying their escape and allowing for a dogfight between the starfighters of both sides. The 204th managed to escape after 387 seconds of fighting, down two pilots, while the New Republic lost none. The duration the skirmish lasted was declared a new record during a celebration held by the New Republic pilots after. The Deliverance continued to pursue the 204th through more comm bursts.
The alphanumeric designated system was mentioned in the 2021 novel Victory's Price, written by Alexander Freed.
